in the philippines, it is widely planted as a shade tree.

in this study, the isolation and identification of epilupeol , lupenone and chlorophyll a from the leaves; lupenone, and lupeol from the peduncle; and lupeol, unsaturated triglycerides , spinasterol , and spinasterone from the twigs of samanea saman are reported.

isolation of chemical constituents the air-dried leaves (264 g), petioles (43 g) and twigs (165 g) of samanea saman were separately ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for three days and then filtered to afford crude extracts: leaves lupeol, 34 g), petioles (0.42 g) and stems epilupeol, 56 g).

literature search on the chemical constituents of samanea saman revealed the presence of octacosanol, alpha-spinasterol, beta-dglucose of alpha-spinasterol, kaempferol and pithecolobine from the different parts of the tree.

lupeol exhibited anticancer activities against pancreatic , prostate [22-23], ovarian , colorectal and myeloma , breast , stomach , cervical [26-28], lymphoma , leukemia [26, 29], melanoma and neuroblastoma , melanoma [25-27, 2930], and lung [25-28, 30] cancers.

research journal of pharmaceutical, biological and chemical sciences triterpenes and sterols from samanea saman.
samanea saman jacq merr of the family fabaceae is commonly known as acacia or rain tree.
samanea saman was reported to exhibit potent antimicrobial, molluscicidal, nematicidal, hemolytic, and hypercholesterolemic properties.
sample collection the sample was collected from the de la salle university-manila campus in july 2013.

the 10% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions from the chromatography of the crude leaves extract was rechromatographed lupeol, ) in 5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford lupenone, lupeol, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the 10% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions from the chromatography of the crude twigs extract was rechromatographed chlorophyll a, ) in 5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford alpha-spinasterone, lupenone, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the 20% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions from the chromatography of the crude twigs extract was rechromatographed triglycerides, ) in 5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford triglycerides, chlorophyll a, mg).

the 20% to 30% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions from the chromatography of the crude petioles extract were combined and rechromatographed chlorophyll a, ) in issn: 0975-8585 july august 2014 rjpbcs triglycerides, page no.

the 30% to 40% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions from the chromatography of the crude twigs extract were combined and rechromatographed lupenone, ) in 10% etoac in petroleum ether, followed by 12.5% etoac in petroleum ether.

the 30% to 50% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions from the chromatography of the crude petioles extract were combined and rechromatographed chlorophyll a, ) in 10% etoac in petroleum ether, followed by 12.5% etoac in petroleum ether.

the 40% to 50% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions from the chromatography of the crude leaves extract were combined and rechromatographed lupeol, ) in 15% etoac in petroleum ether to afford chlorophyll a, lupeol, mg) after washing with petroleum ether, followed by et2o.
the crude extract was fractionated by silica gel chromatography using increasing proportions of acetone in dichloromethane (10 % increments) as eluents. ml fractions were collected.
the crude extracts were separately fractionated by silica gel chromatography using increasing proportions of acetone in dichloromethane (10 % increments) as eluents.

the dichloromethane extract of samanea saman afforded epilupeol , lupenone and chlorophyll a from the leaves; lupenone, and lupeol from the peduncle; and lupeol, unsaturated triglycerides , alpha-spinasterol , and alphaspinasterone from the twigs.

the dichloromethane extract of samanea saman afforded epilupeol , lupenone and chlorophyll a from the leaves; lupenone, and lupeol from the peduncles; and lupeol, unsaturated triglycerides , alpha-spinasterol , and alpha-spinasterone from the twigs.
the fractions eluted with 10% etoac in petroleum ether were combined and rechromatographed chlorophyll a, ) in the same solvent to afford lupeol, lupeol, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the fractions eluted with 10% etoac in petroleum ether were combined and rechromatographed lupenone, ) in the same solvent to afford lupeol, lupenone, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the fractions eluted with 12.5% etoac in petroleum ether were combined and rechromatographed chlorophyll a, ) in the same solvent to afford lupenone, chlorophyll a, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the fractions eluted with 12.5% etoac in petroleum ether were combined and rechromatographed lupeol, ) in the same solvent to afford alpha-spinasterol, chlorophyll a, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the structures of epilupeol, lupenone, chlorophyll a, lupeol, triglycerides, alpha-spinasterol, alpha-spinasterone, were identified by comparison of their 1h and/or 13c nmr data with those reported in the literature [12-18]. although bioassays were not conducted on the isolated compounds, there were previous studies that reported on their biological activities.

the structures of epilupeol, lupenone, chlorophyll a, lupeol, triglycerides, alpha-spinasterol, were identified by comparison of their epilupeol, h and/or 13 c nmr data with those reported in the literature.

the volatile constituents of samanea saman have been reported with palmitic acid (55.5%), epilupeol, 8-cineole (15.9%), and oleic acid alpha-spinasterone, 4%) as the major constituents lupenone, lupeol, . another study reported the isolation of lupeol and epilupeol from the whole plant of samanea saman.
